did.unittitle: Central Washington University Board of Trustees, Annual Retreats
did.abstract: This collection contains information packets to annual retreats, handbooks, and special meeting minutes and notes of the Central Washington University Board of Trustees from 1985 to 1998.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Central Washington University Board of Trustees was established as part of a legislative act to create the Washington State Normal School at Ellensburg on March 28, 1890. The first board of trustees consisted of the Governor, the State Superintendent of Public Instruction and three others to be appointed by the Governor. The Trustees first met in the summer of 1890. The board of trustees was appointed to establish and review university policies and oversee the general management of funds and properties of the school. Currently the board is composed of eight trustees, seven of whom are appointed for six-year terms by the governor of Washington State with the consent of the Senate, and one of whom is a student appointee that changes yearly.

scopecontent.p: Included in these records of the Central Washington University Board of Trustees (1985-1998) are consultant requests and board assessment committee notes, contracts and interviews from 1995 to 1998.

odd.p: Central Washington University began as the Washington State Normal School in 1891. In 1937, the school was rechristened the Central Washington College of Education. In 1961, the school became Central Washington State College and, finally, in 1977, Central Washington University.

arrangement.p: Organized alphabetically by subject title of file folder

accessrestrict.p: Open to the public for educational research
